comments:
In a higher product, we're seeing an intermittent problem when opening the 
method invocation table. That is, profile something, open the method 
statistics view, right click on a method and open the method invocation, then 
right click in that view and open the method invocation table.

The result is that you get the general "An error has occured" dialog, and it 
keeps appearing after clicking OK. The exception in the log file is always the 
same (see below).

Because I can't seem to reproduce this (it was reported by our QE team), I am 
opening this bug for investigation. If this can't be reproduced, then please 
add more error checking in the code and see if you can fail a little more 
gently. For example, if it can't find the class for a method, then replace it 
with "Unknown", or something like that. Also, since it's a null pointer, it 
would be best to do some null checks, and simply not try to display those.

Fixed in 3.3 and 4.0.

In a higher product, opening certain views causes additional aggregated 
invocations to be added to the model. However, these are not actually "real" 
instances of invocations, they are aggregated and represent the topology of a 
call graph. The problem was visible in both the method invocation and method 
invocation table views - the method invocation view would show more 
invocations than there actually were, and the table would cause error popups, 
as well as show extra empty invocations in the table. The fix in both cases is 
to not try to show all TRCMethodInvocations, but instead go one level deeper 
and only show TRCFullMethodInvocations. This avoids the aggregated entries, 
which were causing the problem in this case.
